title: Ticket #3354: condor_root_switchboard performance problem with large fdset size
description:
Burt reports performance problems because of condor_root_switchboard closing all the FDs up to getrlimit(rlimit_NOFILE). On the glidein factory, it is common to have ulimit -n around 50k.

I'm not aware of a better solution than to use an OS-specific technique such as iterating through /proc/pid/fds to avoid iterating through all 50k FDs, most of which are not open.

A workaround is for the caller of the switchboard to set a lower limit for number of open files. Since reducing the limit does not force higher-numbered fds to be closed, one may need to be careful if there is a concern about leaving some FDs open.
remarks:
2012-Nov-30 18:02:17 by bbockelm:
Note that iterating through /proc/self/fd isn't async signal safe. Thus, it can't be used after-fork-before-exec.

Might be OK for the switchboard, but definitely can't do it in daemon core!

Lots of other Unixes solve this nicely. I found this page: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1643304/how-to-set-close-on-exec-by-default

2019-Feb-09 08:55:36 by bbockelm:
Closing this ticket as the root switchboard is no longer relevant.
